marklogic.body:
Nature Advocate
As an ex-farmer and hunter I know what it's like to run a farm.
As for TNR (trap neuter release) the R means release the animal where the animal was trapped and no where else if this is done properly TNR works and you don't get the build up of cats in one area that you claim in fact the numbers of course decrease, common sense. Our farm as well as all the other farms in the area had cats dogs cows pigs chickens and never any of the problems you speak of in your posts, these animals tend to stay to them selves. If a TNR group is releasing animals in one Spot you need to deal with that directly. If you make it hurt their money they will stop. This would not be happening if it were anywhere near me because I would work to make sure they lost money and sleep it's very important that they lose sleep. But if some someone insisted on the killing way then they would be the ones losing sleep. Believe it or not once they stop and they Always stop, they feel good about it. So using this approach is actually a friendly gesture and in the best interest of all involved.
Funny thing being around a farm and all that goes on can callus a person and lower they'r reguard for living beings including themselves, it's a pretty shitty life (no pun intended) but being around a hospital only effects a persons view of other people.
